content: I think I'll go with the Tamiya figures, they seem to have a good reputation for accuracy and detail. For painting, I'll make sure to research the specific uniform colors and insignia for the Japanese soldiers and ground crew during that time period. I'll also try to add some weathering and washes to give them a more realistic look. As for integrating them into the diorama, I'll experiment with different poses and placements to create a sense of movement and interaction with the environment. Maybe I'll have one of the ground crew members working on the Zero fighter, and another soldier resting in the shade. Thanks for the tips and recommendations!
